title: Tasks queue
content:
The Tasks queue enables you to view and manage manual tasks that are assigned to you, assigned to your groups, as well as tasks that have been completed by you recently. You can access all manual tasks if you have the Ability to view all tasks permission.

View your tasks

  1. On the main menu, select Tasks.

  2. Select a view to view the corresponding tasks. You can select one of the following OOB views, or you can select a custom view.

    • MY TASKS: tasks directly assigned to you.

    • MY GROUP TASKS: tasks assigned to your groups.

    • MY RECENTLY COMPLETED TASKS: tasks assigned to you and completed in the past month.

    If you have the "Ability to view all tasks" permission, the following OOB views are also available:

    • ALL MY TASKS: tasks assigned to you or your groups, and your recently completed tasks.

    • ALL TASKS: all tasks.

    Note that the tasks displayed for custom views that were created based on the ALL TASKS view differ, depending on whether you have the "Ability to view all tasks" permission:

    • If you have the permission, you will see tasks that match the filter criteria associated with the view.

    • If you don't have the permission, you will see only those tasks that are assigned to you or your groups and match the filter criteria.

    By default the grid displays the following information about the task:

    • ID: The task ID
    • Title: The title of the task
    • Phase ID: The ID of the current phase of the task
    • Priority: The priority of the task
    • Requestor: The requester of the task
    • Parent entity: The type and title of the record in which the task is created

    In the right pane, the details of the task are displayed at the top, and details of the parent record are displayed below that.

  3. To sort the grid, click the heading of the column by which you want to sort the grid. By default, tasks are displayed by descending (highest to lowest) priority.

  4. To filter the tasks, click the Add filter  button on the left.

Manage your tasks

  1. On the main menu, select Tasks.

  2. Select the task record that you want to edit.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  4. Edit the task details in the General tab. The following sections are available:

    • Review

      Enter comments in the Reviewer Comments field.

    • Context record

      The following fields are displayed:

      Field Description
      Priority

      The priority of the task.

      This value is copied from the parent record and automatically filled in by the system.
      Requestor

      The user who opened the parent record of the task.

      This value is copied from the parent record and automatically filled in by the system.

    • Task properties

      The following fields are displayed:

      Field Description
      Description A description of the task. This field is read-only.
      Assignment group

      The group assigned to perform the task.

      Example: Windows Tower team

      This field is read-only.
      Assignee

      The user assigned to perform the task.

      This field is read-only.
      Completion summary A summary of the completion of the task
      Billed duration Select the duration (in days, hours, and minutes) for billing purposes.
      Task plan showstopper Failure of the task indicates a showstopper
      Requires review Indicates that review is required after implementing the task

    • Scheduling

      Note: these fields are informational only, and don't actually change when the task is run.
      The following fields are displayed:

      Field Description
      Planned start date The date the task is to start
      Planned end date The date by which the task should be completed
      Actual start time

      The time the task started. This field is read-only
      Actual end time

      The time the task finished. This field is read-only

    • External

      The following fields are displayed:

      Field Description
      External contact Select the contact representing the external supplier or vendor if they are registered as a contact in Service Management.
      External contact detail Enter contact information for the external party. This is especially relevant if they aren't registered as a Service Management contact.
      External process reference Enter the ticket ID of the ticket opened with the supplier.

    • Attachments

      Click Add attachment if you want to attach a file to the record.

      • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.

      • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.

      • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

  5. Click Save.

When the task moves to the Completed/Canceled phase, it's automatically removed from the Tasks queue.

Error handling for automated tasks

For an automated task, the system retrieves the OO flow execution result or the REST call result from OPB, updates the task Completion status based on the result, and then calls the task service to update the task result by passing over the task Completion status. 

  • The Failed phase is based on the execution result of the OO flow or REST call that the automated task is running. An automated task is in the Failed phase when the OO flow or REST call returns a result of failure. If the OO flow or REST call is still running, the task remains in Running status.
  • An automated task also has a Task Completion code of Success. This is also based on the successful execution of the REST call or OO flow.
